results.headline: Car Trouble of the Unexpected Kind
results.summary_short: Nearly all the action and drama happens in a rental car in “Vehicle 19,” a film by Mukunda Michael Dewil.

results.headline: Family Secrets Unravel All in a Day’s Work
results.summary_short: Complications pile up when a young woman goes searching for a father she hasn’t seen since childhood in Erin Greenwell’s small-town comedy, “My Best Day.”

results.headline: Part Man, Part God, All Hunk
results.summary_short: “Man of Steel” weaves the Superman story into the fabric of 20th-century America and surrounds it with epic-scale cosmic effects.

results.headline: Elite Assassins Wield Spinning Blades That Slice Off Heads
results.summary_short: Andrew Lau, best known for the “Infernal Affairs” trilogy, goes back in time and dreams up new ways of killing in “The Guillotines.”

results.headline: Clean Break Is Increasingly Hard to Make
results.summary_short: In “Aliyah,” a low-level drug dealer in Paris, who longs to give up his perilous occupation, is given an opportunity to start life over in Israel.

results.headline: Young Indian Slackers, Biding Their Sweet Time
results.summary_short: The Hindi comedy “Fukrey,” directed by Mrighdeep Singh Lamba, follows the tribulations of four young Delhi-ites.

results.headline: Hunting for Monster Waves Far Out on the Sea
results.summary_short: Two Australian buddies who are professional surfers go out to sea in search of newer and bigger waves.

results.headline: In a Horror Flick, the Chilling Effect of Vegetables
results.summary_short: In Peter Strickland’s “Berberian Sound Studio,” a shy British sound engineer tries to keep his sanity while working on the soundtrack for an Italian horror film.

results.headline: Twinkly Totems of Fame, Theirs for the Taking
results.summary_short: “The Bling Ring” was inspired by the true story of affluent Hollywood teenagers who broke into celebrities’ homes to steal luxury items.

results.headline: Turning Up the Voices From the Background
results.summary_short: The documentary “20 Feet From Stardom” seeks to rewrite the history of pop music by focusing attention on voices at once marginal and vital.

results.headline: Whoa, the Apocalypse. We’re Still Buds, Right?
results.summary_short: In “This Is the End,” celebrity buddies find their relationships tested as biblical devastation arrives.

results.headline: Asking Environmentalists Not to Fear the Reactor
results.summary_short: The documentarian Robert Stone lines up experts to advocate nuclear energy in his new film, “Pandora’s Promise.”

results.headline: In Fields and Hives, Zooming In on What Ails Bees
results.summary_short: The documentary “More Than Honey” focuses on the world’s troubled bee population and how it’s being threatened.

results.headline: Playwright Is Dead; Show Goes On
results.summary_short: In “You Ain’t Seen Nothin’ Yet,” the French director Alain Resnais, who just turned 91, continues his decades-long exploration of the slippery line between truth and illusion.

results.headline: Arguing Their Way Into Love
results.summary_short: Joss Whedon’s adaptation of “Much Ado About Nothing” draws out the essential screwball nature of Shakespeare’s comedy.

results.headline: For Art Prodigies, a Seminary and Crucible
results.summary_short: The documentary “Fame High” trains its cameras on the Los Angeles County High School for the Arts, where dance, music and theater students struggle to develop expertise and succeed.

results.headline: Fast Rise and Fast Fall of Television’s Tough Guy
results.summary_short: “Évocateur: The Morton Downey Jr. Movie” chronicles the rise and fall of this 1980s talk-show host.

results.headline: From the Front Lines, if You Can See Them
results.summary_short: Richard Rowley’s “Dirty Wars” examines the hidden war on terror run by the United States.

results.headline: Four Go Over, but Only Three Come Back
results.summary_short: In “Wish You Were Here” two Australian couples go to Cambodia for a whirlwind vacation. When one in the group disappears, secrets about the others emerge.

results.headline: Young Femmes Fatales, Doing Their Job
results.summary_short: Two teenage girls (Alexis Bledel and Saoirse Ronan) are the hired killers in “Violet & Daisy,” written and directed by Geoffrey Fletcher.
